page.title: 09ROYAL CHARTER MOELFRE 2
page.content: On Monday, 10th July we visited Porth Helaeth to see the divers salvaging the Royal Charter. We could see their camp- a large white tent. There were three divers on watch all night guarding the equipment. The camp was swarming with photographers and journalists. We had our photos taken for the newspapers. Out at sea we could see several buoys where the divers had marked the length of the wreck. We were amazed at its size. Above the wreck there was a rubber dinghy, two boats and a large pipe between them. The pipe sucked up mud from the wreck. Three quarters of The R.Ch is buried under 20ft of mud. This must be cleared. The divers have only cleared 20sq.ft. of sand, but have found lots of treasure and artefacts. Kim Howard
